description.compact: Geocode an address-string to a set of coordinates using Google's free geocoding services.

docblock.description:
see: http://code.google.com/apis/maps/documentation/geocoding/index.html
CHECKS IF CURL / file_get_contents is available Requirements: allow_url_fopen = on

todo.value: Implement client-side selection when multiple results are found (through validation-errors and javasript)

docblock.description: needs to be static because we use static methods in this class

description.compact: default user to first result that is returned.
tells you if CURL / file_get_contents is available set to true , unless it is not sure if CURL is available
Get first placemark as flat array
Get first placemark from google, or return false.

comment.value: we just take the first address!

param.description: Place name (e.g. 'Portland' or '30th Avenue, New York")

description.compact: OGLE: reet_address indicates a precise street address.

docblock.description:
ute indicates a named route (such as "US 101"). tersection indicates a major intersection, usually of two major roads. litical indicates a political entity. Usually, this type indicates a polygon of some civil administration. untry indicates the national political entity, and is typically the highest order type returned by the Geocoder. ministrative_area_level_1 indicates a first-order civil entity below the country level. Within the United States, these administrative levels are states. Not all nations exhibit these administrative levels. ministrative_area_level_2 indicates a second-order civil entity below the country level. Within the United States, these administrative levels are counties. Not all nations exhibit these administrative levels. ministrative_area_level_3 indicates a third-order civil entity below the country level. This type indicates a minor civil division. Not all nations exhibit these administrative levels. lloquial_area indicates a commonly-used alternative name for the entity. cality indicates an incorporated city or town political entity. blocality indicates an first-order civil entity below a locality ighborhood indicates a named neighborhood emise indicates a named location, usually a building or collection of buildings with a common name bpremise indicates a first-order entity below a named location, usually a singular building within a collection of buildings with a common name stal_code indicates a postal code as used to address postal mail within the country. tural_feature indicates a prominent natural feature. rport indicates an airport. rk indicates a named park. int_of_interest indicates a named point of interest. Typically, these "POI"s are prominent local entities that don't easily fit in another category such as "Empire State Building" or "Statue of Liberty."
st_box indicates a specific postal box. reet_number indicates the precise street number. oor indicates the floor of a building address. om indicates the room of a building address.
: atitude' => 'Double(12,7)', ongitude' => 'Double(12,7)', ointString' => 'Text', ddress' => 'Text', ullAddress' => 'Text', ountryNameCode' => 'Varchar(3)', dministrativeAreaName' => 'Varchar(255)', ubAdministrativeAreaName' => 'Varchar(255)', ocalityName' => 'Varchar(255)', ostalCodeNumber' => 'Varchar(30)',

description.compact: Converts Google Response INTO Silverstripe Google Map Array that can be saved into a GoogleMapLocationsObject
